content.description:
Magnum propiusque noscendum ut eruditissimoeruditus, -a, -um, adj.: well-educated viro 
visum. Iubet liburnicamliburnica, -ae, f.: fast-sailing warship aptariapto, -are = paro, -are; mihi si venire una vellem 
facit copiam; respondi studere me malle, et forte ipse quod 
scriberem dederat.
content.question: In line 3, respondi studere me malle is translated

choices.label: I responded that I preferred to study
I responded that I did not want to study
because he responded to me, I wanted to study
he responded that he preferred for me to study

content.answer: I responded that I preferred to study

unit.text: 2: Pliny's Letters: Eruption of Mt. Vesuvius
